predicate.note: Frames file for 'dance' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 51.5, 47.3, 26.7-1; Framenet entry Self-motion.

roleset.name: dance!

example.name: intransitive
example.text: One had best *trace* not dance on top of a coffin until the lid is sealed tightly shut.''
example.arg: until the lid is sealed tightly shut

roleset.note: One also hopes that this is metaphorical.

example.name: with partner
example.text: The Camden County congressman still carries himself with a trademark ``I'm-coming-down-your-throat'' intensity, but at a pause in Newark's Columbus Day parade recently, he was dancing with his wife in the middle of the avenue in the city's old Italian-American ward.
example.arg: at a pause in Newark's Columbus Day parade
in the middle of the avenue
in the city's old Italian-American ward

example.name: oh you New York Girls
example.text: John dances the polka whenever he gets the chance.

example.name: now that's a storm
example.text: Cupboard doors were flying, the trash can in the kitchen walked a few feet, the dogs came running, and I scooted them into the dog run and stood in the doorway myself, watching the outside trash cans dance across the concrete.
